duration_in_months: The estimated level of effort of the contract will be for 240 days per year.\nEstimated time frame of contract – January 22, 2023 to January 31, 2026 plus three (3) irrevocable option years.
full_summary:
# Request for Proposal (RFP) Announcement

## Intermediate Database Analyst / Information Management Administrator

### Project Overview

The Department of National Defence (DND) invites proposals from pre-qualified suppliers under the Task Based Informatics Professional Services (TBIPS) Supply Arrangement to provide Intermediate Database Analyst / Information Management Administrator services.

### Tender Details

**Solicitation Number:** W8485-TBIPS2022-03/A
**Publication Date:** November 4, 2022
**Tender Closing Date:** November 22, 2022 (14:00:00)
**Contract Duration:** Three (3) years, with two (2) one-year options
**Location:** National Capital Region (Gatineau, QC)

### Requirements

* One (1) Intermediate Database Analyst / Information Management Administrator (Level II)
* The successful bidder will provide services to support the Propulsion Group Sustainment (PGS) within ADM(Mat)/DGAEPM
* Estimated level of effort: 240 days per year
* Security Requirements: FSC - Secret

### Pre-Qualified Suppliers

Only the following companies that have been pre-qualified under the stated consultant categories, level of expertise, security level, region, and tier are eligible to bid on this requirement:

01 Millennium Consulting Inc.
02 2iSolutions Inc.
03 4Plan Consulting Corp.
...
115 Zernam Enterprise Inc

### Proposal Submission

Proposals must be submitted in English or French. The RFP documents will be emailed directly to pre-qualified suppliers. No proposals will be accepted on the Government Electronic Tendering System (Buy and Sell).

### Contact Information

Tony Seng
Contact: Tony.Seng@forces.gc.ca
Phone: 819-939-4148

### Evaluation Criteria

The proposal evaluation will be based on the RFP documents and the criteria outlined in the evaluation matrix.

### Notice of Expiration

This tender has expired. Interested suppliers should contact the Contracting Authority to inquire about potential future opportunities.

Note to the stylist: 
* Use Canadian English.
* Consider removing repetitive and unnecessary information. 
* Ensure you use proper sentence structure and punctuation.
* Be concise and directly communicate the essential information.
* Format the output in markdown format with numbered lists and headers.
* Keep in mind that overall length should not exceed 400 words and SME (Subject Matter Experts) review
